#Text=Unclog a
#Text=Toilet with Dish Soap
#Text=A clogged toilet is something we 've all experienced : the rising of water to the brim , the sense of panic as it does n't stop , the scurrying for the plunger .
#Text=But dish soap is a simple solution that can bring you back from the fate of a flood of toilet water with nothing but your favorite product and some hot water !
#Text=Whether you start by pouring the boiling water into the toilet or adding dish soap , if all goes well the end result is unclogged piping .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Soaking the Bowl in Boiling Water
#Text=Locate the toilet flapper and stop water flow from the tank .
#Text=Remove the lid from your toilet tank and locate the toilet flapper .
#Text=The flappers are typically black , blue , or red and provide the seal for the flush valve .
#Text=Either close it using the chain attached or with your hands .
#Text=To prevent water supply altogether , turn the handle behind the toilet near the floor in a clockwise direction .
#Text=If you 're having trouble turning the handle , apply an oil spray .
#Text=Do n't worry about contaminated water in the toilet tank — germs do not enter this part of the fixture .
#Text=If you 're worried , wash your hands thoroughly afterward .
#Text=Boil a pot of water .
#Text=Turn your stove on high heat and place a water-filled pot onto the stove .
#Text=Then , cover your pot with a lid and wait for the water to boil .
#Text=You can also fill the pot or bucket with hot water from the tap , but make sure it 's as hot as possible — the higher the temperature , the more effective it will be at fighting the clog .
#Text=If you only have a smaller pot or bucket , fill it up multiple times until you have about of boiling , or very hot , water .
#Text=Pour of hot water into the bowl .
#Text=Pour gently and make sure the water does n't pass the rim .
#Text=Be careful not to spill any to avoid burning yourself .
#Text=If your bucket has a metal handle , hold it up with one hand and tilt the bucket with your other hand by turning it from the bottom .
#Text=Wait for the water to rise to the rim after pouring the water .
#Text=Adding Dish Soap
#Text=Pour about of dish soap into the water .
#Text=The dish soap will float to the bottom of the bowl because it is heavier and denser than water .
#Text=Let the soap sit for about 20 to 30 minutes .
#Text=After this time , the water should lower .
#Text=Always pour the water slowly and be careful not to overflow the bowl .
#Text=Pour another of boiling water into the toilet .
#Text=Fill another pot with hot water and place it onto the stove to boil .
#Text=Again , hot water is also effective , but boiling water is always ideal .
#Text=Turn the stove on high heat for the fastest results .
#Text=Continue pouring water into the toilet and let it sit .
#Text=After about 2 to 3 rounds , flush the toilet to check if the clog is gone .
#Text=Be sure to give each of boiling water about 20 minutes to settle .
#Text=Wait overnight if your toilet is still not flushing properly .
#Text=If it 's not unclogged in the morning , try using a plunger .
#Text=Plunge your toilet
#Text=if it 's still clogged .
#Text=Even if you 've already tried to plunge the clog , dish soap can weaken it , so it 's always worth a second shot ! Place the plunger into the bowl and aim it at the hole .
#Text=Press down sharply in short , fast strokes , and be sure to lift sharply to create suction .
#Text=After 4 or 5 full strokes , lift the plunger on the last upward motion
#Text=Run the plunger under hot water for 30 seconds prior to plunging to warm the rubber up .
#Text=If the clog still does n't come loose , call a plumber .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=bucket
#Text=Dish soap
#Text=Plunger
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Always wash your hands clean with warm water and soap after working on your toilet .
#Text=Never plunge your toilet immediately after using drain cleaner .
